dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, Microsoft just took down six fake websites set up by the Fancy Bear group.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, Microsoft just took down six fake websites set up by the Fancy Bear group.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Microsoft obtained orders to shut down a total of six websites created by the Fancy Bear group (which Microsoft calls Strontium).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they were targeting Republican think tanks this time—the International Republican Institute and the Hudson Institute.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they were targeting Republican think tanks this time-the International Republican Institute and the Hudson Institute.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But in its latest tussle with the so-called Fancy Bear group, Microsoft has sought to stymie what it believes are attempts to attack Republican, not Democrat, groups. The two targets appeared to be two think tanks: the International Republican Institute and the Hudson Institute.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and former Senator John McCain sits on the IRI board, which makes it a high-profile target.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and former Senator John McCain sits on the I R I board, which makes it a high-profile target.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Senator John McCain sits on the IRI board, as does former White House national security advisor General H.R. McMaster, while the Hudson Institute has a strong focus on foreign policy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though, because these fake sites were designed to mimic the real ones, like my-iri.org, to steal login credentials.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though, because these fake sites were designed to mimic the real ones, like the website, to steal login credentials.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fake websites designed to mimic the organizations real sites, ostensibly in anticipation of a future cyberattack, were taken down by Microsoft. The references to Sharepoint, email and Microsoft productivity tools indicated the hackers wanted to steal target passwords for those services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and it reminds me of the 2016 election attacks—like when John Podesta fell for that fake Google login page.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and it reminds me of the twenty sixteen election attacks-like when John Podesta fell for that fake Google login page.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For instance, in attacks on the Hillary Clinton campaign, the hackers set up fake Google login pages for the candidates staff. John Podesta, Clintons campaign manager, was one of those who fell for the ruse, with catastrophic consequences.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that was devastating. And Microsoft's president, Brad Smith, said this pattern mirrors what they saw before the 2016 and 2017 elections.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that was devastating. And Microsoft's president, Brad Smith, said this pattern mirrors what they saw before the twenty sixteen and twenty seventeen elections.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taken together, this pattern mirrors the type of activity we saw prior to the 2016 election in the United States and the 2017 election in France.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But here's the thing—they don't actually know for sure who the ultimate targets were. It could've been others, like that Insured Retirement Institute with a similar domain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But here's the thing-they don't actually know for sure who the ultimate targets were. It could've been others, like that Insured Retirement Institute with a similar domain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though it issued a strong warning about interference in the upcoming midterms, Microsoft said it had no evidence to indicate the identity of the ultimate targets of any planned attack involving these domains. It's possible the domains couldve been used to target other organizations than the two institutes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but the Hudson Institute spokesperson pointed out it was likely aimed at disrupting their democracy-promotion programs, especially exposing foreign kleptocratic regimes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but the Hudson Institute spokesperson pointed out it was likely aimed at disrupting their democracy-promotion programs, especially exposing foreign kleptocratic regimes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We can only assume that this attack was intended to gather information about, and compromise or otherwise disrupt, Hudsons longstanding democracy-promotion programs, and in particular, our initiatives to expose the activities of foreign kleptocratic regimes, the spokesperson added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Daniel Twining from IRI called it part of the Kremlin's campaign to sow confusion and fear among critics of Putin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Daniel Twining from I R I called it part of the Kremlin's campaign to sow confusion and fear among critics of Putin.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: IRI president Daniel Twining added: This latest attempt is consistent with the campaign of meddling that the Kremlin has waged against organizations that support democracy and human rights. It is clearly designed to sow confusion, conflict and fear among those who criticize Mr. Putins authoritarian regime.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Microsoft's been pretty proactive though—they've done this 12 times in two years, shutting down 84 fake websites linked to Fancy Bear.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Microsoft's been pretty proactive though-they've done this twelve times in two years, shutting down eighty four fake websites linked to Fancy Bear.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Smith said the Redmond giant had carried out similar domain seizures 12 times in two years to shut down 84 fake websites associated with Fancy Bear.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and back in July, they warned about hacking attempts on three members of Congress. Senator Claire McCaskill later confirmed she was targeted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and back in July, they warned about hacking attempts on three members of Congress. Senator Claire McCaskill later confirmed she was targeted.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In July, Microsoft warned that domains had been set up in apparent hacking attempts on three members of Congress. Not long after, Senator Claire McCaskill, a Democrat in Missouri, confirmed she'd been a target of the Fancy Bear crew.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But so far, no evidence the hackers succeeded this time around. Still, they're building infrastructure aiming at the midterms.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But so far, no evidence the hackers succeeded this time around. Still, they're building infrastructure aiming at the midterms.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Again, there was no evidence to suggest the hackers had been successful. But they remain active and are building infrastructure that appears to be targeting the midterms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's just… concerning how persistent they are, right? Targeting across the political spectrum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just... concerning how persistent they are, right? Targeting across the political spectrum.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And think tanks like these are full of former officials with valuable insights—prime targets for espionage.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And think tanks like these are full of former officials with valuable insights-prime targets for espionage.
